context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 indicates good capacity for focused work. Weekend schedule allows for flexible timing and recovery periods.
strategic_priorities: Prepare home for Hunter's return at 10pm
Complete meal planning and grocery shopping
time_constraints: Need to clean office and bathroom before 10pm

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Front-load echo project work in early morning when energy is fresh (6-9:30am). Golf break mid-day provides natural energy reset. Afternoon block for home tasks and grocery shopping. Evening available for additional echo work if energy permits. Build in buffer time for transitions and unexpected delays.
reasoning.energy_optimization: Capitalize on morning peak energy for complex echo project work. Golf provides active recovery and social engagement. Schedule lower-energy tasks (tidying, shopping) for afternoon when natural energy dip occurs. Keep evening flexible for either continued work or relaxation based on actual energy levels.
reasoning.priority_sequencing: 1) Echo project (highest stated priority), 2) Golf commitment (fixed time), 3) Home preparation for Hunter, 4) Meal planning/grocery shopping. This sequence ensures critical work happens when energy is highest and fixed commitments are met.
reasoning.recovery_planning: Golf serves as active recovery and mental break from coding. Post-golf lunch provides refueling opportunity. Tidying and shopping offer movement-based recovery from desk work. Evening wind-down time built in before Hunter's arrival.

schedule.title: Morning Routine
schedule.note: Light breakfast, coffee, review echo project goals

schedule.title: echo | MVP Project Setup
schedule.note: Peak energy window - focus on completing project setup for MVP. 3-hour deep work block to make significant progress.

schedule.title: Golf Prep & Travel
schedule.note: Get ready, grab golf gear, drive to course (30 min away)

schedule.title: Golf Warm-up
schedule.note: Arrive at course, check in, warm up at range

schedule.title: Golf with Jacob
schedule.note: 9 holes with Jacob Smyle - enjoy the social time and fresh air

schedule.title: Travel Home & Lunch
schedule.note: Drive home and grab a quick lunch to refuel

schedule.title: personal | Meal Planning
schedule.note: Plan meals for the week, create shopping list

schedule.title: personal | Grocery Shopping
schedule.note: Shop for weekly groceries based on meal plan

schedule.title: personal | Tidy Home
schedule.note: Focus on office and bathroom for Hunter's return

schedule.title: echo | Continue Development
schedule.note: Optional evening session if energy permits - continue MVP work

schedule.title: personal | Evening Wind-down
schedule.note: Relax, final home touches, prepare for Hunter's arrival

schedule.title: personal | Hunter Welcome
schedule.note: Be ready to welcome Hunter home at 10pm

key_insights: 3-hour morning block maximizes high energy for echo MVP progress
Golf provides perfect mid-day break and social connection
Afternoon tasks strategically placed during natural energy dip
Home preparation completed well before Hunter's 10pm arrival
Optional evening coding session provides flexibility based on actual energy
